intro: Pilosella walteri-langii, commonly known as the Walter's pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces showy, daisy-like blooms with white petals and a central disk, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Pilosella walteri-langii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
